title: The New American Cul-de-sac
text:
Many advertisements for homeownership in the first half of the century showed a Caucasian man in a suit and fedora, standing proudly before a single-family, suburban home with his wife and children.

While the idea of homeownership has long been a symbol of prosperity in the American psyche—as revered as baseball, burgers, and apple pie—it's historically been reserved for this particular subset of Americans.

But thanks to legislation and gradual cultural shifts, homeownership has become more diverse than it once was, though there’s plenty more work to be done. And REALTORS®, members of the National Association of REALTORS®, have a role to play in extending the dream of homeownership to all: Today, the National Association of REALTORS® adheres to a modern Code of Ethics upholding the idea that everyone deserves to own a home.
